alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico; King William; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 17 at 4:58PM EDT until October 17 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... The City of Richmond in central Virginia... Northeastern Chesterfield County in central Virginia... Northwestern Charles City County in east central Virginia... Northwestern New Kent County in east central Virginia... Henrico County in central Virginia... Southeastern Hanover County in central Virginia... Central King William County in east central Virginia... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 458 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Lakeside to Downtown Richmond to near Bon Air, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Mechanicsville and East Highland Park around 505 PM EDT. Highland Springs around 510 PM EDT. Studley around 515 PM EDT. Bottoms Bridge and Manquin around 530 PM EDT. Roxbury and Tunstall around 535 PM EDT. Talleysville around 545 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Wayside, Richmond Heights, Mountcastle, Elko, Montrose, Sandston, Glendale, Westwood, Richmond International and Fair Oaks. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico; King William; New Kent
